required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mold Sensitization Associated Severe Asthma Exacerbation
clinical_study.official_title: Is Mold Sensitization Associated With Severe Asthma Exacerbation in Children?

brief_summary.textblock: Mold sensitization is associated with severe asthma exacerbation.

detailed_description.textblock: Mold sensitization has been reported to be one of the factors that is associated with severe asthma exacerbation (SAE). The objective is to identify the factors that are associated with SAE in asthmatic children particularly mold sensitization.

primary_outcome.measure: Association between mold sensitization and severe asthma exacerbation
primary_outcome.description: Compare mean wheal diameter (mm.) of skin prick test of mold allergen extracts between the group with severe asthma exacerbation and the group without severe asthma exacerbation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Skin test in severe asthma exacerbation
arm_group.description: Skin test in asthmatic children hospitalized due to severe asthma exacerbation in a preceding year
Skin test in asthmatic children without severe asthma exacerbation in a preceding year

intervention.description: Demographic data review, Disease severity evaluation, Treatment evaluation and Skin prick test for 16 common aeroallergens
intervention.arm_group_label: Skin test in severe asthma exacerbation

study_pop.textblock: Asthmatic children aged 1-15 years old from Pediatric Allergy and Immunology division devided in to 2 groups: 1. hospitalized due to severe asthma exacerbation in a preceding year and 2. without severe asthma exacerbation in a preceding year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Asthmatic children aged 1-15 years old from Pediatric Allergy and Immunology division with hospitalized due to severe asthma exacerbation in a preceding year and without severe asthma exacerbation in a preceding year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other serious systemic diseases, pregnant, lactation
